1563     * should use {@link EllipticalMap} or {@link EllipticalHammerMap} for this.
1564     * {@link HyperellipticalMap} is also a nice option because it can project onto a shape between a
1565     * rectangle (like this class) and an ellipse (like EllipticalMap), with all-round sides.
1566     * <a href="http://yellowstonegames.github.io/SquidLib/SphereWorld.png" >Example map</a>.
1567     */
1568    public static class SphereMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
1569        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 2.6, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
1570        //protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.65, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
1571        private double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1572                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1573                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1574
1575        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
1576        public final double[][] xPositions,
1577                yPositions,
1578                zPositions;
1579
1580
1581        /**
1582         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1583         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1584         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1585         * Always makes a 256x128 map.
1586         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1587         * If you were using {@link SphereMap#SphereMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
1588         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
1589         */
1590        public SphereMap() {
1591            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
1592        }
1593
1594        /**
1595         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1596         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1597         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1598         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
1599         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
1600         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1601         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1602         *
1603         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1604         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1605         */
1606        public SphereMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
1607            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
1608        }
1609
1610        /**
1611         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1612         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1613         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1614         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1615         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1616         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1617         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1618         *
1619         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1620         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1621         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1622         */
1623        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
1624            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
1625        }
1626
1627        /**
1628         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1629         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1630         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1631         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1632         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1633         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1634         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
1635         *
1636         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1637         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1638         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1639         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
1640         */
1641        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
1642            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
1643        }
1644
1645        /**
1646         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1647         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1648         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1649         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
1650         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
1651         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1652         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1653         *
1654         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1655         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1656         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1657         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
1658         */
1659        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
1660            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
1661        }
1662
1663        /**
1664         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
1665         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
1666         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
1667         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
1668         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
1669         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
1670         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
1671         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
1672         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
1673         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
1674         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
1675         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
1676         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
1677         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
1678         * that don't require zooming.
1679         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
1680         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1681         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1682         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise#instance}
1683         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
1684         */
1685        public SphereMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
1686            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
1687            xPositions = new double[width][height];
1688            yPositions = new double[width][height];
1689            zPositions = new double[width][height];
1690
1691            terrain = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq));
1692            terrainLayered = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
1693            heat = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  heatFreq);
1694            moisture = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  moistureFreq);
1695            otherRidged = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq));
1696        }
1697        @Override
1698        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
1699            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
1700        }
1701
1702        /**
1703         * Given a latitude and longitude in radians (the conventional way of describing points on a globe), this gets the
1704         * (x,y) Coord on the map projection this generator uses that corresponds to the given lat-lon coordinates. If this
1705         * generator does not represent a globe (if it is toroidal, for instance) or if there is no "good way" to calculate
1706         * the projection for a given lat-lon coordinate, this returns null. This implementation never returns null.
1707         * If this is a supported operation and the parameters are valid, this returns a Coord with x between 0 and
1708         * {@link #width}, and y between 0 and {@link #height}, both exclusive. Automatically wraps the Coord's values using
1709         * {@link #wrapX(int, int)} and {@link #wrapY(int, int)}.
1710         * @param latitude the latitude, from {@code Math.PI * -0.5} to {@code Math.PI * 0.5}
1711         * @param longitude the longitude, from {@code 0.0} to {@code Math.PI * 2.0}
1712         * @return the point at the given latitude and longitude, as a Coord with x between 0 and {@link #width} and y between 0 and {@link #height}, or null if unsupported
1713         */
1714        // 0.7978845608028654 1.2533141373155001
1715        @Override
1716        public Coord project(double latitude, double longitude) {
1717            int x = (int)((((longitude - getCenterLongitude()) + 12.566370614359172) % 6.283185307179586) * 0.15915494309189535 * width),
1718                    y = (int)((NumberTools.sin(latitude) * 0.5 + 0.5) * height);
1719            return Coord.get(
1720                    wrapX(x, y),
1721                    wrapY(x, y));
1722        }
1723
1724        /**
1725         * Copies the SphereMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only be
1726         * shared to Noise classes.
1727         * @param other a SphereMap to copy
1728         */
1729        public SphereMap(SphereMap other)
1730        {
1731            super(other);
1732            terrain = other.terrain;
1733            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
1734            heat = other.heat;
1735            moisture = other.moisture;
1736            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
1737            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
1738            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
1739            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
1740            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
1741            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
1742            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
1743            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
1744            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
1745            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
1746        }
1747
1748        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
1749                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
1750        {
1751            boolean fresh = false;
1752            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
1753            {
1754                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1755                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1756                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1757                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1758                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1759                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1760                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1761                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1762                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1763                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1764                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1765                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1766                cacheA = stateA;
1767                cacheB = stateB;
1768                fresh = true;
1769            }
1770            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
1771            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
1772            int t;
1773
1774            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
1775            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
1776
1777            double p,
1778                    ps, pc,
1779                    qs, qc,
1780                    h, temp,
1781                    i_w = 6.283185307179586 / width, i_h = 2.0 / (height+2.0),//(3.141592653589793) / (height+2.0),
1782                    xPos = startX, yPos, i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h / (height+2.0);
1783            final double[] trigTable = new double[width << 1];
1784            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
1785                p = xPos * i_w + centerLongitude;
1786                // 0.7978845608028654 1.2533141373155001
1787                trigTable[x<<1]   = NumberTools.sin(p);// * 1.2533141373155001;
1788                trigTable[x<<1|1] = NumberTools.cos(p);// * 0.7978845608028654;
1789            }
1790            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
1791            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
1792                qs = -1 + yPos;//-1.5707963267948966 + yPos;
1793                qc = NumberTools.cos(NumberTools.asin(qs));
1794                //qs = qs;
1795                //qs = NumberTools.sin(qs);
1796                for (int x = 0, xt = 0; x < width; x++) {
1797                    ps = trigTable[xt++] * qc;//NumberTools.sin(p);
1798                    pc = trigTable[xt++] * qc;//NumberTools.cos(p);
1799                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
1800                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
1801                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
1802                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
1803                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
1804                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
1805                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
1806                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
1807                            , qs, seedB));
1808                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
1809                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
1810                            , seedC));
1811
1812                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
1813                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
1814                    if(fresh) {
1815                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
1816                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
1817
1818                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
1819                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
1820
1821                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
1822                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
1823                    }
1824                }
1825                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
1826                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
1827
1828            }
1829            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
1830                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
1831                    hMod;
1832            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
1833            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1834            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1835
1836            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
1837                temp = Math.abs(yPos - 1.0);
1838                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
1839                temp = 2.2 - temp;
1840                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1841//                    heightData[x][y] = (h = (heightData[x][y] - minHeightActual) * heightDiff - 1.0);
1842//                    minHeightActual0 = Math.min(minHeightActual0, h);
1843//                    maxHeightActual0 = Math.max(maxHeightActual0, h);
1844                    h = heightData[x][y];
1845                    heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
1846                    hMod = 1.0;
1847                    switch (t) {
1848                        case 0:
1849                        case 1:
1850                        case 2:
1851                        case 3:
1852                            h = 0.4;
1853                            hMod = 0.2;
1854                            break;
1855                        case 6:
1856                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
1857                            break;
1858                        case 7:
1859                            h *= -0.25;
1860                            break;
1861                        case 8:
1862                            h *= -0.4;
1863                            break;
1864                        default:
1865                            h *= 0.05;
1866                    }
1867                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
1868                    if (fresh) {
1869                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
1870                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
1871                    }
1872                }
1873            }
1874            if(fresh)
1875            {
1876                minHeat1 = ps;
1877                maxHeat1 = pc;
1878            }
1879            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
1880            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1881            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1882            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1883            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1884
1885
1886            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1887                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1888                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
1889                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
1890                    if (fresh) {
1891                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
1892                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
1893                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
1894                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
1895                    }
1896                }
1897            }
1898            if(fresh)
1899            {
1900                minHeat = qs;
1901                maxHeat = qc;
1902                minWet = ps;
1903                maxWet = pc;
1904            }
1905            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
1906            /*
1907            if(generateRivers) {
1908                if (fresh) {
1909                    addRivers();
1910                    riverData.connect8way().thin().thin();
1911                    lakeData.connect8way().thin();
1912                    partialRiverData.remake(riverData);
1913                    partialLakeData.remake(lakeData);
1914                } else {
1915                    partialRiverData.remake(riverData);
1916                    partialLakeData.remake(lakeData);
1917                    int stx = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartX >> zoom) - (width >> 2), 0), width),
1918                            sty = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartY >> zoom) - (height >> 2), 0), height);
1919                    for (int i = 1; i <= zoom; i++) {
1920                        int stx2 = (startCacheX.get(i) - startCacheX.get(i - 1)) << (i - 1),
1921                                sty2 = (startCacheY.get(i) - startCacheY.get(i - 1)) << (i - 1);
1922                        //(zoomStartX >> zoom) - (width >> 1 + zoom), (zoomStartY >> zoom) - (height >> 1 + zoom)
1923
1924//                        Map is 200x100, GreasedRegions have that size too.
1925//                        Zoom 0 only allows 100,50 as the center, 0,0 as the corner
1926//                        Zoom 1 allows 100,50 to 300,150 as the center (x2 coordinates), 0,0 to 200,100 (refers to 200,100) as the corner
1927//                        Zoom 2 allows 100,50 to 700,350 as the center (x4 coordinates), 0,0 to 200,100 (refers to 600,300) as the corner
1928
1929
1930                        System.out.printf("zoomStartX: %d zoomStartY: %d, stx: %d sty: %d, stx2: %d, sty2: %d\n", zoomStartX, zoomStartY, stx, sty, stx2, sty2);
1931                        if ((i & 3) == 3) {
1932                            partialRiverData.zoom(stx, sty).connect8way();
1933                            partialRiverData.or(workingData.remake(partialRiverData).fringe().quasiRandomRegion(0.4));
1934                            partialLakeData.zoom(stx, sty).connect8way();
1935                            partialLakeData.or(workingData.remake(partialLakeData).fringe().quasiRandomRegion(0.55));
1936                        } else {
1937                            partialRiverData.zoom(stx, sty).connect8way().thin();
1938                            partialRiverData.or(workingData.remake(partialRiverData).fringe().quasiRandomRegion(0.5));
1939                            partialLakeData.zoom(stx, sty).connect8way().thin();
1940                            partialLakeData.or(workingData.remake(partialLakeData).fringe().quasiRandomRegion(0.7));
1941                        }
1942                        //stx = (width >> 1) ;//Math.min(Math.max(, 0), width);
1943                        //sty = (height >> 1);//Math.min(Math.max(, 0), height);
1944                    }
1945                    System.out.println();
1946                }
1947            }
1948            */
1949        }
1950    }
1951    /**
1952     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto an ellipse that should be
1953     * twice as wide as it is tall (although you can stretch it by width and height that don't have that ratio).
1954     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mollweide_projection">Mollweide projection</a>.
1955     * <a href="http://yellowstonegames.github.io/SquidLib/EllipseWorld.png" >Example map</a>.
1956     */
1957    public static class EllipticalMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
1958        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.35, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
1959        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 2.6, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
1960        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1961                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
1962                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1963
1964        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
1965        public final double[][] xPositions,
1966                yPositions,
1967                zPositions;
1968        protected final int[] edges;
1969
1970
1971        /**
1972         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1973         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1974         * Always makes a 200x100 map.
1975         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1976         * If you were using {@link EllipticalMap#EllipticalMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
1977         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
1978         */
1979        public EllipticalMap() {
1980            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
1981        }
1982
1983        /**
1984         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
1985         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
1986         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
1987         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
1988         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
1989         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
1990         *
1991         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1992         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
1993         */
1994        public EllipticalMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
1995            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
1996        }
1997
1998        /**
1999         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
2000         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
2001         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2002         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2003         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2004         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2005         *
2006         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2007         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2008         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2009         */
2010        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
2011            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
2012        }
2013
2014        /**
2015         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
2016         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
2017         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2018         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2019         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2020         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
2021         *
2022         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2023         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2024         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2025         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2026         */
2027        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
2028            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
2029        }
2030
2031        /**
2032         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
2033         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
2034         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2035         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2036         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2037         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail. The suggested Noise3D
2038         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}.
2039         *
2040         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2041         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2042         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2043         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2044         */
2045        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
2046            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
2047        }
2048
2049        /**
2050         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
2051         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
2052         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
2053         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
2054         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
2055         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
2056         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
2057         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.  FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
2058         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
2059         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
2060         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
2061         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
2062         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
2063         * that don't require zooming.
2064         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2065         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2066         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2067         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2068         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2069         */
2070        public EllipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
2071            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
2072            xPositions = new double[width][height];
2073            yPositions = new double[width][height];
2074            zPositions = new double[width][height];
2075            edges = new int[height << 1];
2076            terrain = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq));
2077            terrainLayered = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
2078            heat = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  heatFreq);
2079            moisture = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  moistureFreq);
2080            otherRidged = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq));
2081        }
2082
2083        /**
2084         * Copies the EllipticalMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
2085         * be shared to Noise classes.
2086         * @param other an EllipticalMap to copy
2087         */
2088        public EllipticalMap(EllipticalMap other)
2089        {
2090            super(other);
2091            terrain = other.terrain;
2092            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
2093            heat = other.heat;
2094            moisture = other.moisture;
2095            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
2096            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
2097            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
2098            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
2099            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
2100            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
2101            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
2102            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
2103            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
2104            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
2105            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
2106        }
2107
2108        @Override
2109        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
2110            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2111            if(x < edges[y << 1])
2112                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
2113            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
2114                return edges[y << 1];
2115            else return x;
2116        }
2117
2118        @Override
2119        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
2120            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2121        }
2122
2123        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
2124                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
2125        {
2126            boolean fresh = false;
2127            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
2128            {
2129                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2130                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2131                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2132                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2133                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2134                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2135                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2136                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2137                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2138                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2139                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2140                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2141                cacheA = stateA;
2142                cacheB = stateB;
2143                fresh = true;
2144            }
2145            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
2146            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
2147            int t;
2148
2149            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
2150            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
2151
2152            double p,
2153                    ps, pc,
2154                    qs, qc,
2155                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
2156                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
2157                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
2158                    th, thx, thy, lon, lat, ipi = 0.99999 / Math.PI,
2159                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.0 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
2160                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
2161
2162            yPos = startY - ry;
2163            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2164                thx = NumberTools.asin((yPos) * iry);
2165                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? thx : Math.PI * irx * 0.5 / NumberTools.cos(thx);
2166                thy = thx * 2.0;
2167                lat = NumberTools.asin((thy + NumberTools.sin(thy)) * ipi);
2168
2169                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
2170                qs = NumberTools.sin(lat);
2171
2172                boolean inSpace = true;
2173                xPos = startX;
2174                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
2175                    th = lon * (xPos - hw);
2176                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
2177                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
2178                        inSpace = true;
2179                        continue;
2180                    }
2181                    if(inSpace)
2182                    {
2183                        inSpace = false;
2184                        edges[y << 1] = x;
2185                    }
2186                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
2187                    th += centerLongitude;
2188                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
2189                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
2190                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
2191                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
2192                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
2193                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
2194                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2195                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
2196                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
2197                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
2198                            , qs, seedB));
2199                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
2200                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
2201                            , seedC));
2202                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
2203                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
2204                    if(fresh) {
2205                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
2206                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
2207
2208                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
2209                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
2210
2211                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
2212                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
2213                    }
2214                }
2215                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
2216                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
2217
2218            }
2219            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
2220                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
2221                    hMod,
2222                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
2223            yPos = startY + i_uh;
2224            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2225            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2226
2227            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2228                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
2229                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
2230                temp = 2.2 - temp;
2231                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2232                    h = heightData[x][y];
2233                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
2234                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
2235                        continue;
2236                    }
2237                    else
2238                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
2239                    hMod = 1.0;
2240                    switch (t) {
2241                        case 0:
2242                        case 1:
2243                        case 2:
2244                        case 3:
2245                            h = 0.4;
2246                            hMod = 0.2;
2247                            break;
2248                        case 6:
2249                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
2250                            break;
2251                        case 7:
2252                            h *= -0.25;
2253                            break;
2254                        case 8:
2255                            h *= -0.4;
2256                            break;
2257                        default:
2258                            h *= 0.05;
2259                    }
2260                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
2261                    if (fresh) {
2262                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
2263                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
2264                    }
2265                }
2266            }
2267            if(fresh)
2268            {
2269                minHeat1 = ps;
2270                maxHeat1 = pc;
2271            }
2272            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
2273            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2274            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2275            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2276            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2277
2278
2279            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2280                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2281                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
2282                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
2283                    if (fresh) {
2284                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
2285                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
2286                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
2287                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
2288                    }
2289                }
2290            }
2291            if(fresh)
2292            {
2293                minHeat = qs;
2294                maxHeat = qc;
2295                minWet = ps;
2296                maxWet = pc;
2297            }
2298            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
2299        }
2300    }
2301
2302    /**
2303     * An unusual map generator that imitates an existing map (such as a map of Earth, which it can do by default). It
2304     * uses the Mollweide projection (an elliptical map projection, the same as what EllipticalMap uses) for both its
2305     * input and output; <a href="https://yellowstonegames.github.io/SquidLib/MimicWorld.png">an example can be seen here</a>,
2306     * imitating Earth using a 512x256 world map as a GreasedRegion for input.
2307     */
2308    public static class MimicMap extends EllipticalMap
2309    {
2310        public GreasedRegion earth;
2311        public GreasedRegion shallow;
2312        public GreasedRegion coast;
2313        public GreasedRegion earthOriginal;
2314        /**
2315         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should look like Earth using an elliptical projection
2316         * (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2317         * Always makes a 512x256 map.
2318         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2319         * If you were using {@link MimicMap#MimicMap(long, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
2320         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
2321         */
2322        public MimicMap() {
2323            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL
2324                    , DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
2325        }
2326
2327        /**
2328         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2329         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2330         * The initial seed is set to the same large long every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when
2331         * you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
2332         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2333         *
2334         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2335         */
2336        public MimicMap(GreasedRegion toMimic) {
2337            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, toMimic,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
2338        }
2339
2340        /**
2341         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2342         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2343         * Takes an initial seed and the GreasedRegion containing land positions. The {@code initialSeed}
2344         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2345         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
2346         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2347         *
2348         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2349         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2350         */
2351        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic) {
2352            this(initialSeed, toMimic, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
2353        }
2354
2355        /**
2356         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2357         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2358         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and a multiplier that affects the level
2359         * of detail by increasing or decreasing the number of octaves of noise used. The {@code initialSeed}
2360         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2361         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
2362         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
2363         *
2364         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2365         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2366         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2367         */
2368        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, double octaveMultiplier) {
2369            this(initialSeed, toMimic, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
2370        }
2371
2372        /**
2373         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2374         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2375         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and parameters for noise generation (a
2376         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}. The {@code initialSeed}
2377         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call
2378         * {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact. Both FastNoise
2379         * and FastNoise make sense to use for {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter
2380         * because this will change the seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static
2381         * {@link FastNoise#instance} or {@link FastNoise#instance} because they have no changing state between runs
2382         * of the program). Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2383         *
2384         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2385         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2386         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
2387         */
2388        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
2389            this(initialSeed, toMimic, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
2390        }
2391
2392        /**
2393         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
2394         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
2395         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, parameters for noise generation (a
2396         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a multiplier on how many
2397         * octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers producing even more
2398         * detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
2399         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
2400         * cannot be changed after the fact.  FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
2401         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
2402         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
2403         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
2404         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
2405         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
2406         * that don't require zooming.
2407         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2408         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
2409         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
2410         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2411         */
2412        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
2413            super(initialSeed, toMimic.width, toMimic.height, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
2414            earth = toMimic;
2415            earthOriginal = earth.copy();
2416            coast   = earth.copy().not().fringe(2);
2417            shallow = earth.copy().fringe(2);
2418        }
2419
2420        /**
2421         * Stores a 512x256 GreasedRegion that shows an Earth map with elliptical (Mollweide) projection, in a format
2422         * that can be read back with {@link GreasedRegion#decompress(String)}. By using GreasedRegion's compression,
2423         * this takes up a lot less room than it would with most text-based formats, and even beats uncompressed binary
2424         * storage of the map by a factor of 5.8. The map data won't change here, so this should stay compatible.
2425         */
2426        public static final String EARTH_ENCODED = "Ƥ䊅⑃л䢤㱢ġ٤Ȩࠪ捘Ϝᇌᐰࡐဣ₈䁭âŴനð᱀ᄣϢĢሢŤ\u0087倰…䇍Ĉథ䠨䇰ᢐ࠲ࠨ¨I䗴₧≠だₐ‴䞑ห攠℡ı©ý 傠ʓᤣ窠猡ᄡᤣഡढ愠祒㈡戢ቴ摊╓̀⫀ᄡ亨䜅ਁ灑㢠扠㏁唼⽪䐡㘢ᄡ碠䑅♁儰\u0EA8ӤϻıĒ䁤\u0A7E〨ᠪ䔲ੂƲ您䀪⁝Ꭱ䮦⁄Њǰᅺ兎⊱๚䮯㞵⌱祥䆠ౠ↤\u2E75সסˀӄઃق※瀣ǥ呔²Œ屚ౠ⿈ᄦ䄸ˤűᕱÈ䁁ݕ㮱ࠥ否噂ő<ɠኰ`⤠䍠⸳Ӱᒛ ᠪ䐝⬬֨台䑆ื䊈摤အᐡ祰ᾳ䠠樢ぞĩ昫䋮♡⊓攔㲫₧䆨※ࠨ䉒Ṗࡊ孱⡠Ằܨ㔐湖⍰ᇊ֦٠灆䣝ཤĄ䂦\u2BE3Ƒ⪱ؤ掴ᅺ‥㠯䌙⮘⢯≓䅴፧▪ᄬͼ㊀མ㍹䍁刲⋹䋨掞䭠⁅Ỽᱭ䨡䲠ℶᧄđ\u0090怼䠤向⡍ڪ䋕ڊ佈䈱ޔ 䊱⮛ࣷ䔙:†涽ࢴ䵂ಀ愠Š⪠瘮囼䉐Ԭρ䧂ᡕ䞩y⁊ࠡ䨠㵞⚯灱僋㕰جɁ&⁕㓄eĂ厠䒓ᆶ㏣ᵢô䁘〩㈥⁃\u0E5C䧀ᆝ┽ឨ嚤ᴶ䗣䌰\u173Dᔄǅ$⇷[㏋ᤰ̴İȬ䈠䩀∨Ź¨အ䬡楩้ུ\u0ABA偒\u0A4A济Ђf‡С㪀⮱Ƞ彠⸨懚㦄焐෨䄠⧀ᒠ昤အ™穝䄻尮⠲ၠฤԴ琧吅ै䋱Yࠩ所䀡⠬䒈…吧̚ȴw\u2064\u0E66\u0096瀴䕡E倠䏁䀷ࠨ䄠Ḁᔤ\u0084䀨\u2062歵䮡灱ॢॴ*ၠՒԕT䠡欀㲡䈰䐺⤜摱₹ࢽ朆睐抈笹悜ȼ䝂䀺ᠭⴘܣ㔰҈ć\u0084ƤA䂄檢b 抸䨳⏠禡Ű㜳䀤ᰲ䁩扚С㒠稻႐䀻⠠ₔ‸ᆢ珎ӑ㬭ⷒ㨻䇚ഥჼ\u202DⰤ窵ㄧ眀塀䈼ᘣᢨဠآၠªѡE〱ȠN∨»¼҃㨭ဠ䄡灅ओ繶愊倷ޢ\u0092ᠾ䕹2瀫ኌ∰2Ġ❀×₠നྠ㓞ښѠښڐ曞掁湧́<倳Ƽ͡Җ䀳㠥僨⚪രጨ攠◌ტ抨န硆ᄦᛈဠ㌣⭤ࠢ流ࡀ͔ƄȲ揸䀢堮Ӡ壩ⴘㅘ䄠㝀ᔤâ䁅ୁ㕓仲噄泩戬ू噱♌㋿ٓ㜯࣪㒑٣⩥䢢\u009D恂ǋ棎ө㛁嚅⟓䂀ᗍ勥῀ʬɈ䲡卪卐䐰廼䋀᮲噰䀷䠤ℨ㨨砱㭀煐ٰⷤፗ愠㽀ᄤc䂐⡠獑䠣熡࠴枤䩀ȴΪ\u2D29ێ咨䋍ล戵ⱼ䝬Ⲫ䂀ೃʙ䐰ŊxḨÛºᔥ䂠ỰФᒕ丫㎻㏪桬ମ㈉Â⡎ޠⰄཐ梨『ဤ䝼࠸䴀䳓⠱慠\u0B98ЊṂ瑡⾀⊰䐧¿ᡌ灁\u2438徵-〱ᤰ俿煈崊㏀Ҭ䢆祡\u2D76䐺愎朰W8ԩᠡ䄞ԑ垰䋀㷵⺇Ӡ䀥㘥媄˰䎯棡暼匳ǆဠ㤠Ⓕ沋ἡ䤯恁㊴彬ƶ䘇梉戁Ῡ䐭嶱ㅕ䆰⍁ᢅᚐク䄈Ԩ㸳ǌᡀ㡀Ͼ3ᳲ¦≠捁呪䅐⭭擘ཀ䐡खᢠ䴡䮙\u18AC\u2060ՄȢっ獍Ϡ䌡Ẻ䇡罥樜劺偐⭈ᨄJ怤ᅐ‰⡓☨縊壎䓡ᨢᄠް\u0A49ᤰǘₐ䍠娿䴨䦠⠼ؠ㸈¢!倫\u2060⏰㩂ПᖃЦ㔰ࡈ¹䁝匒ⴠ㠰䂤尻ㅬ幤ࠫၺ↦\u0560τʀ⽀၆ᓰस㉢ఴ絪⤚䢪K〱ĠᅰÁ夿䵤ဣ媡劬䇓䡩縦ˣބ⽠дǢ⢦㔼䯀牥↿洍࠰\u009Dòပᤲ䳹ŃⰦ⧤Ḧ㲔Өᘅ⣂ɼ\u0A29儠ǘఢ挰ť\u0092᩵⠰Ø䀤Ս⬭屔⺲6࠭㴱崠碲䃰‡⨠ࡊ\u202D…ᘣ⋂䈠ᇀಊC戮䣑ဣ羡࠰Ò䄘\u0B59派䃮唢I瀿䎝ୱ療÷ᙥⳞ吠祀ᄤ;怿ͪ㥬y恀☠☨ᡂ5倩₱\u0984ᴧ砭⫃䑵Ӱ歌榚◠㜦䁘რ⻈劳\u1CA5ࡠ\u07BAŚ⾥穌䙀ㆥᢍ桠儣⍁᧡Әႈ尮᭪〞⅁䂙Ӱᤡᠸ\u0382瀴ᅯᙣ桠ьGᵁ睺煒榯䁵䄱\u0BBC㶜ጢ扩䁴榤摠ƺቀ⑨အ呠ଇ䠸ρᏩ䅸塂呧ͬਐ၊䲘፣䠺䨝ᄯ汯 ⶁ劄ᴧ猢جΧૡࠠ⺠ፉ䂠ϼ؞学撐䵃ⴹ恀\u2BF4䮅烒ࠨ⭬灰䀥␤\u2060۬ˀᎃ䑥Ӑ⅏゚ᛠ到č$ౢത秆ಠᗎࢹ⌤\u2060ö̂灳恄➦䐧傚Ⓚ嬹ᬲᄣ纥⛀Ⴠ稬ʮ溮䊫ฺ砥䢤啂倢⒠䆅羐♱ྷ淮Ȁුロ⟘⮌媚枧籠畴䐫ĕ戻ٰj䄈\u0ADC䆰Ԡࠐੈ໕Ġᴈਙ害素ரཔ爸ᠴ㖂剈䍬⍄E偘䊢畤桯\u08C0㎫䱤ঀᠰ䴠ᯨڈ稱ǆ⥡灔柔ണ㬧䉩䰨/䁾◬咨ý灠ጶħҠٴЊ竉烈̰᰾悋¢=࠱᧐㡈瑀º[ᐇ䝧㈑㍑擃䞈إচⶑ妷慈ဣŁ࠰Ĩ䁺ॠ㳢㳨ဠ甠☵⌈ᄢ3ဨ䇾ሃ嬰䈸➬惧༖㐊䂠तզ䰫䈌䲲㕯ƨ〡䬡䶯〮Ӳ[ࠨ㵘〣\u0081⠼㰏ƢF㠫䆨ᑡ䗕←‧ᡡ₀䱮ॅ砿䋸⫧‴Α㈿Ô\u1FF0伶䊄‧务瘵㈸֒ࡔܰᾤ\u20F1䊇᳃䃸ᔢ*〪入\u1CA9瀾䡨怢帠ࠫȠⓀᬗ改坊⍄ށؤبJ\u2064ݢ⎃夦␁磣憨㢠桽ሠᭀ\u0C65⨢㕈ᔇ犖\u0EFC甡₶χ峣壄ǁ℥傅\u1CA7䢭Ȱ⤭䢱đ䲳₭䭻搲㉺㎤ᾔӮ䘌攀丑≍⫉ʼ㌲沟ᐂ灘㿠ㆦ摌Áᤞ⃮䓲娾昱⪬ĮЮ℣ᐔ١廹曀■⁼ዔ․ḡ㨕䅬⥴㫞囘⤩䡅ডୣĠ\u1778ศ༠ᆄᎅ埀Ϛþ所濗♀†弢娐㗀怢䴢ᑊ←⭡屒☪⤤ᬌ\u0D51唰ǳ¤⠡庠Ըి᪡姲娑䅢R㠪嵘\u09DB攺݂…ㅁ䙆䂜∥㧏䤭䙭⠽懠㐭嵈š  ";
2427        
2428        /**
2429         * Constructs a 512x256 elliptical world map that will use land forms with a similar shape to Earth.
2430         * @param initialSeed
2431         * @param noiseGenerator
2432         * @param octaveMultiplier
2433         */
2434        public MimicMap(long initialSeed, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier)
2435        {
2436            this(initialSeed,
2437                    GreasedRegion.decompress(EARTH_ENCODED), noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
2438        }
2439
2440        /**
2441         * Copies the MimicMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
2442         * be shared to Noise classes.
2443         * @param other a MimicMap to copy
2444         */
2445        public MimicMap(MimicMap other)
2446        {
2447            super(other);
2448            earth = other.earth.copy();
2449            earthOriginal = other.earthOriginal.copy();
2450            coast   = other.coast.copy();
2451            shallow = other.shallow.copy();
2452        }
2453
2454
2455
2456        /**
2457         * Meant for making maps conform to the Mollweide (elliptical) projection that MimicMap uses.
2458         * @param rectangular A GreasedRegion where "on" represents land and "off" water, using any rectangular projection
2459         * @return a reprojected version of {@code rectangular} that uses an elliptical projection
2460         */
2461        public static GreasedRegion reprojectToElliptical(GreasedRegion rectangular) {
2462            int width = rectangular.width, height = rectangular.height;
2463            GreasedRegion t = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
2464            double yPos, xPos,
2465                    th, thx, thy, lon, lat, ipi = 0.99999 / Math.PI,
2466                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.0 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
2467                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
2468    
2469            yPos = -ry;
2470            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos++) {
2471                thx = NumberTools.asin((yPos) * iry);
2472                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? thx : Math.PI * irx * 0.5 / NumberTools.cos(thx);
2473                thy = thx * 2.0;
2474                lat = NumberTools.asin((thy + NumberTools.sin(thy)) * ipi);
2475                xPos = 0;
2476                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos++) {
2477                    th = lon * (xPos - hw);
2478                    if (th >= -3.141592653589793 && th <= 3.141592653589793
2479                            && rectangular.contains((int) ((th + 1) * hw), (int) ((lat + 1) * ry))) {
2480                        t.insert(x, y);
2481                    }
2482                }
2483            }
2484            return t;
2485        }
2486
2487        @Override
2488        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
2489            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2490            if(x < edges[y << 1])
2491                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
2492            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
2493                return edges[y << 1];
2494            else return x;
2495        }
2496
2497        @Override
2498        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
2499            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
2500        }
2501
2502        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
2503                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
2504        {
2505            boolean fresh = false;
2506            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
2507            {
2508                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2509                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2510                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2511                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2512                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2513                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2514                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2515                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2516                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2517                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2518                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2519                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2520                cacheA = stateA;
2521                cacheB = stateB;
2522                fresh = true;
2523            }
2524            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
2525            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
2526            int t;
2527
2528            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
2529            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
2530
2531            earth.remake(earthOriginal);
2532
2533            if(zoom > 0)
2534            {
2535                int stx = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartX - (width  >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), width ),
2536                        sty = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartY - (height >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), height);
2537                for (int z = 0; z < zoom; z++) {
2538                    earth.zoom(stx, sty).expand8way().fray(0.5).expand();
2539                }
2540                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
2541                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
2542            }
2543            else
2544            {
2545                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2);
2546                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2);
2547            }
2548            double p,
2549                    ps, pc,
2550                    qs, qc,
2551                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
2552                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
2553                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
2554                    th, thx, thy, lon, lat, ipi = 0.99999 / Math.PI,
2555                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.0 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
2556                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
2557            yPos = startY - ry;
2558            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2559
2560                thx = NumberTools.asin((yPos) * iry);
2561                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? thx : Math.PI * irx * 0.5 / NumberTools.cos(thx);
2562                thy = thx * 2.0;
2563                lat = NumberTools.asin((thy + NumberTools.sin(thy)) * ipi);
2564
2565                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
2566                qs = NumberTools.sin(lat);
2567
2568                boolean inSpace = true;
2569                xPos = startX;
2570                for (int x = 0/*, xt = 0*/; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
2571                    th = lon * (xPos - hw);
2572                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
2573                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
2574                        inSpace = true;
2575                        continue;
2576                    }
2577                    if(inSpace)
2578                    {
2579                        inSpace = false;
2580                        edges[y << 1] = x;
2581                    }
2582                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
2583                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
2584                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
2585                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
2586                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
2587                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
2588                    if(earth.contains(x, y))
2589                    {
2590                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc + terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2591                                ps, qs, seedA)) * 0.85;
2592                        if(coast.contains(x, y))
2593                            h += 0.05;
2594                        else
2595                            h += 0.15;
2596                    }
2597                    else
2598                    {
2599                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc + terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
2600                                ps, qs, seedA)) * -0.9;
2601                        if(shallow.contains(x, y))
2602                            h = (h - 0.08) * 0.375;
2603                        else
2604                            h = (h - 0.125) * 0.75;
2605                    }
2606                    heightData[x][y] = h;
2607                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
2608                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
2609                            , qs, seedB));
2610                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
2611                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
2612                            , seedC));
2613                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
2614                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
2615                    if(fresh) {
2616                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
2617                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
2618
2619                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
2620                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
2621
2622                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
2623                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
2624                    }
2625                }
2626                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
2627                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
2628
2629            }
2630            double heightDiff = 2.0 / (maxHeightActual - minHeightActual),
2631                    heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
2632                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
2633                    hMod,
2634                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / (halfHeight);
2635            double minHeightActual0 = minHeightActual;
2636            double maxHeightActual0 = maxHeightActual;
2637            yPos = startY + i_uh;
2638            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2639            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2640
2641            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
2642                temp = Math.pow(Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half, 1.5);
2643                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
2644                temp = 2.2 - temp;
2645                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2646//                    heightData[x][y] = (h = (heightData[x][y] - minHeightActual) * heightDiff - 1.0);
2647//                    minHeightActual0 = Math.min(minHeightActual0, h);
2648//                    maxHeightActual0 = Math.max(maxHeightActual0, h);
2649                    h = heightData[x][y];
2650                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
2651                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
2652                        continue;
2653                    }
2654                    else
2655                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
2656                    hMod = 1.0;
2657                    switch (t) {
2658                        case 0:
2659                        case 1:
2660                        case 2:
2661                        case 3:
2662                            h = 0.4;
2663                            hMod = 0.2;
2664                            break;
2665                        case 6:
2666                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
2667                            break;
2668                        case 7:
2669                            h *= -0.25;
2670                            break;
2671                        case 8:
2672                            h *= -0.4;
2673                            break;
2674                        default:
2675                            h *= 0.05;
2676                    }
2677                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
2678                    if (fresh) {
2679                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
2680                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
2681                    }
2682                }
2683            }
2684            if(fresh)
2685            {
2686                minHeat1 = ps;
2687                maxHeat1 = pc;
2688            }
2689            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
2690            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2691            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2692            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
2693            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2694
2695
2696            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2697                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2698                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
2699                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
2700                    if (fresh) {
2701                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
2702                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
2703                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
2704                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
2705                    }
2706                }
2707            }
2708            if(fresh)
2709            {
2710                minHeat = qs;
2711                maxHeat = qc;
2712                minWet = ps;
2713                maxWet = pc;
2714            }
2715            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
2716        }
2717
2718    }
2719    /**
2720     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that imitates an infinite-distance perspective view of a
2721     * world, showing only one hemisphere, that should be as wide as it is tall (its outline is a circle). This uses an
2722     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthographic_projection_in_cartography">Orthographic projection</a> with
2723     * the latitude always at the equator.
2724     * <a href="http://yellowstonegames.github.io/SquidLib/SpaceViewMap.png" >Example map, showing circular shape as if viewed
2725     * from afar</a>
2726     */
2727    public static class SpaceViewMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
2728        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.65, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
2729        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 2.6, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
2730        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
2731                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
2732                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2733
2734        public final Noise3D terrainRidged, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainBasic;
2735        public final double[][] xPositions,
2736                yPositions,
2737                zPositions;
2738        protected final int[] edges;
2739
2740        /**
2741         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2742         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2743         * Always makes a 100x100 map.
2744         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2745         * If you were using {@link SpaceViewMap#SpaceViewMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
2746         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
2747         */
2748        public SpaceViewMap() {
2749            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
2750        }
2751
2752        /**
2753         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2754         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2755         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
2756         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
2757         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2758         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2759         *
2760         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2761         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2762         */
2763        public SpaceViewMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
2764            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
2765        }
2766
2767        /**
2768         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2769         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2770         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2771         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2772         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2773         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2774         *
2775         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2776         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2777         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2778         */
2779        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
2780            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
2781        }
2782
2783        /**
2784         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2785         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2786         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2787         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2788         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2789         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
2790         *
2791         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2792         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2793         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2794         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2795         */
2796        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
2797            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
2798        }
2799
2800        /**
2801         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2802         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2803         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
2804         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
2805         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
2806         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
2807         *
2808         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2809         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2810         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2811         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2812         */
2813        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
2814            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
2815        }
2816
2817        /**
2818         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
2819         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
2820         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
2821         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
2822         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
2823         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
2824         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
2825         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
2826         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
2827         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
2828         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
2829         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
2830         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
2831         * that don't require zooming.
2832         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
2833         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2834         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
2835         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
2836         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
2837         */
2838        public SpaceViewMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
2839            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
2840            xPositions = new double[width][height];
2841            yPositions = new double[width][height];
2842            zPositions = new double[width][height];
2843            edges = new int[height << 1];
2844            terrainRidged = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq));
2845            terrainBasic = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325); 
2846            heat = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator, heatFreq);
2847            moisture = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator, moistureFreq); 
2848            otherRidged = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq));
2849        }
2850
2851        /**
2852         * Copies the SpaceViewMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
