4225                minWet = ps;
4226                maxWet = pc;
4227            }
4228            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4229        }
4230    }
4231
4232
4233
4234    /**
4235     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that imitates an infinite-distance perspective view of a
4236     * world, showing only one hemisphere, that should be as wide as it is tall (its outline is a circle). It should
4237     * look as a world would when viewed from space, and implements rotation differently to allow the planet to be
4238     * rotated without recalculating all the data, though it cannot zoom. Note that calling
4239     * {@link #setCenterLongitude(double)} does a lot more work than in other classes, but less than fully calling
4240     * {@link #generate()} in those classes, since it doesn't remake the map data at a slightly different rotation and
4241     * instead keeps a single map in use the whole time, using sections of it. This uses an
4242     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthographic_projection_in_cartography">Orthographic projection</a> with
4243     * the latitude always at the equator; the internal map is stored as a {@link SphereMap}, which uses a
4244     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cylindrical_equal-area_projection#Discussion">cylindrical equal-area
4245     * projection</a>, specifically the Smyth equal-surface projection.
4246     * <br>
4247     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/WNa5nQ1.gifv">Example view of a planet rotating</a>.
4248     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/NV5IMd6.gifv">Another example</a>.
4249     */
4250    public static class RotatingSpaceMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
4251        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4252                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4253                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4254
4255        public final double[][] xPositions,
4256                yPositions,
4257                zPositions;
4258        protected final int[] edges;
4259        public final SphereMap storedMap;
4260        /**
4261         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4262         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4263         * Always makes a 100x100 map.
4264         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4265         * If you were using {@link RotatingSpaceMap#RotatingSpaceMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
4266         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
4267         */
4268        public RotatingSpaceMap() {
4269            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4270        }
4271
4272        /**
4273         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4274         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4275         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
4276         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
4277         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4278         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4279         *
4280         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4281         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4282         */
4283        public RotatingSpaceMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4284            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4285        }
4286
4287        /**
4288         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4289         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4290         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4291         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4292         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4293         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4294         *
4295         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4296         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4297         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4298         */
4299        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4300            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4301        }
4302
4303        /**
4304         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4305         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4306         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4307         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4308         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4309         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
4310         *
4311         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4312         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4313         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4314         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4315         */
4316        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
4317            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
4318        }
4319
4320        /**
4321         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4322         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4323         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4324         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4325         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4326         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4327         *
4328         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4329         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4330         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4331         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
4332         */
4333        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
4334            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
4335        }
4336
4337        /**
4338         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4339         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4340         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
4341         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
4342         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
4343         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4344         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4345         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4346         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4347         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4348         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4349         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4350         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4351         * that don't require zooming.
4352         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4353         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4354         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4355         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
4356         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4357         */
4358        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4359            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
4360            xPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4361            yPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4362            zPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4363            edges = new int[height << 1];
4364            storedMap = new SphereMap(initialSeed, mapWidth << 1, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
4365        }
4366
4367        /**
4368         * Copies the RotatingSpaceMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
4369         * be shared to Noise classes.
4370         * @param other a RotatingSpaceMap to copy
4371         */
4372        public RotatingSpaceMap(RotatingSpaceMap other)
4373        {
4374            super(other);
4375            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
4376            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
4377            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
4378            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
4379            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
4380            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
4381            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
4382            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
4383            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
4384            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
4385            storedMap = new SphereMap(other.storedMap);
4386        }
4387
4388
4389        @Override
4390        public int wrapX(int x, int y) {
4391            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4392            return Math.max(edges[y << 1], Math.min(x, edges[y << 1 | 1]));
4393        }
4394
4395        @Override
4396        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
4397            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4398        }
4399
4400        @Override
4401        public void setCenterLongitude(double centerLongitude) {
4402            super.setCenterLongitude(centerLongitude);
4403            int ax, ay;
4404            double
4405                    ps, pc,
4406                    qs, qc,
4407                    h, yPos, xPos, iyPos, ixPos,
4408                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
4409                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
4410                    th, lon, lat, rho,
4411                    i_pi = 1.0 / Math.PI,
4412                    rx = width * 0.5, irx = i_uw / rx,
4413                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = i_uh / ry;
4414
4415            yPos = startY - ry;
4416            iyPos = yPos / ry;
4417            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh, iyPos += iry) {
4418                boolean inSpace = true;
4419                xPos = startX - rx;
4420                ixPos = xPos / rx;
4421                lat = NumberTools.asin(iyPos);
4422                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw, ixPos += irx) {
4423                    rho = (ixPos * ixPos + iyPos * iyPos);
4424                    if(rho > 1.0) {
4425                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
4426                        inSpace = true;
4427                        continue;
4428                    }
4429                    rho = Math.sqrt(rho);
4430                    if(inSpace)
4431                    {
4432                        inSpace = false;
4433                        edges[y << 1] = x;
4434                    }
4435                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
4436                    th = NumberTools.asin(rho); // c
4437                    lon = removeExcess((centerLongitude + (NumberTools.atan2(ixPos * rho, rho * NumberTools.cos(th)))) * 0.5);
4438
4439                    qs = lat * 0.6366197723675814;
4440                    qc = qs + 1.0;
4441                    int sf = (qs >= 0.0 ? (int) qs : (int) qs - 1) & -2;
4442                    int cf = (qc >= 0.0 ? (int) qc : (int) qc - 1) & -2;
4443                    qs -= sf;
4444                    qc -= cf;
4445                    qs *= 2.0 - qs;
4446                    qc *= 2.0 - qc;
4447                    qs = qs * (-0.775 - 0.225 * qs) * ((sf & 2) - 1);
4448                    qc = qc * (-0.775 - 0.225 * qc) * ((cf & 2) - 1);
4449
4450
4451                    ps = lon * 0.6366197723675814;
4452                    pc = ps + 1.0;
4453                    sf = (ps >= 0.0 ? (int) ps : (int) ps - 1) & -2;
4454                    cf = (pc >= 0.0 ? (int) pc : (int) pc - 1) & -2;
4455                    ps -= sf;
4456                    pc -= cf;
4457                    ps *= 2.0 - ps;
4458                    pc *= 2.0 - pc;
4459                    ps = ps * (-0.775 - 0.225 * ps) * ((sf & 2) - 1);
4460                    pc = pc * (-0.775 - 0.225 * pc) * ((cf & 2) - 1);
4461
4462                    ax = (int)((lon * i_pi + 1.0) * width);
4463                    ay = (int)((qs + 1.0) * ry);
4464                    
4465//                    // Hammer projection, not an inverse projection like we usually use
4466//                    z = 1.0 / Math.sqrt(1 + qc * NumberTools.cos(lon * 0.5));
4467//                    ax = (int)((qc * NumberTools.sin(lon * 0.5) * z + 1.0) * width);
4468//                    ay = (int)((qs * z + 1.0) * height * 0.5);
4469
4470                    if(ax >= storedMap.width || ax < 0 || ay >= storedMap.height || ay < 0)
4471                    {
4472                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
4473                        continue;
4474                    }
4475                    if(storedMap.heightCodeData[ax][ay] >= 1000) // for the seam we get when looping around
4476                    {
4477                        ay = storedMap.wrapY(ax, ay);
4478                        ax = storedMap.wrapX(ax, ay);
4479                    }
4480
4481                    xPositions[x][y] = pc * qc;
4482                    yPositions[x][y] = ps * qc;
4483                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
4484
4485                    heightData[x][y] = h = storedMap.heightData[ax][ay];
4486                    heightCodeData[x][y] = codeHeight(h);
4487                    heatData[x][y] = storedMap.heatData[ax][ay];
4488                    moistureData[x][y] = storedMap.moistureData[ax][ay];
4489
4490                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4491                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4492                }
4493                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4494                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4495            }
4496
4497        }
4498
4499        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4500                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4501        {
4502            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB)// || landMod != storedMap.landModifier || coolMod != storedMap.coolingModifier)
4503            {
4504                storedMap.regenerate(0, 0, width << 1, height, landMod, heatMod, stateA, stateB);
4505                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4506                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4507
4508                minHeight = storedMap.minHeight;
4509                maxHeight = storedMap.maxHeight;
4510
4511                minHeat0 = storedMap.minHeat0;
4512                maxHeat0 = storedMap.maxHeat0;
4513
4514                minHeat1 = storedMap.minHeat1;
4515                maxHeat1 = storedMap.maxHeat1;
4516
4517                minWet0 = storedMap.minWet0;
4518                maxWet0 = storedMap.maxWet0;
4519
4520                minHeat = storedMap.minHeat;
4521                maxHeat = storedMap.maxHeat;
4522
4523                minWet = storedMap.minWet;
4524                maxWet = storedMap.maxWet;
4525
4526                cacheA = stateA;
4527                cacheB = stateB;
4528            }
4529            setCenterLongitude(centerLongitude);
4530            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4531        }
4532    }
4533    /**
4534     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that does no projection of the map, as if the area were
4535     * completely flat or small enough that curvature is impossible to see. This also does not change heat levels at the
4536     * far north and south regions of the map, since it is meant for areas that are all about the same heat level.
4537     * <a href="http://yellowstonegames.github.io/SquidLib/LocalMap.png" >Example map, showing lack of polar ice</a>
4538     */
4539    public static class LocalMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
4540        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 2.6, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
4541        //protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.65, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
4542        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4543                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4544                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4545
4546        public final Noise.Maelstrom2D terrain, otherRidged;
4547        public final Noise.InverseLayered2D heat, moisture, terrainLayered;
4548        public final double[][] xPositions,
4549                yPositions,
4550                zPositions;
4551
4552
4553        /**
4554         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4555         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4556         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4557         * Always makes a 256x128 map.
4558         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4559         * If you were using {@link LocalMap#LocalMap(long, int, int, Noise2D, double)}, then this would be the
4560         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
4561         */
4562        public LocalMap() {
4563            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4564        }
4565
4566        /**
4567         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4568         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4569         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4570         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
4571         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
4572         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4573         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4574         *
4575         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4576         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4577         */
4578        public LocalMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4579            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
4580        }
4581
4582        /**
4583         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4584         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4585         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4586         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4587         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4588         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4589         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4590         *
4591         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4592         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4593         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4594         */
4595        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4596            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4597        }
4598
4599        /**
4600         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4601         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4602         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4603         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4604         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4605         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4606         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
4607         *
4608         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4609         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4610         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4611         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4612         */
4613        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, double octaveMultiplier) {
4614            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
4615        }
4616
4617        /**
4618         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4619         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4620         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4621         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4622         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4623         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4624         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4625         *
4626         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4627         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4628         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4629         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
4630         */
4631        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise2D noiseGenerator) {
4632            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
4633        }
4634
4635        /**
4636         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4637         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4638         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4639         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
4640         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
4641         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
4642         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4643         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4644         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4645         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4646         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4647         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4648         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4649         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4650         * that don't require zooming.
4651         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4652         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4653         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4654         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise#instance}
4655         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4656         */
4657        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise2D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4658            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
4659            xPositions = new double[width][height];
4660            yPositions = new double[width][height];
4661            zPositions = new double[width][height];
4662
4663            terrain = new Noise.Maelstrom2D(new Noise.Ridged2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq));
4664            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
4665            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
4666            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
4667            otherRidged = new Noise.Maelstrom2D(new Noise.Ridged2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq));
4668        }
4669
4670        /**
4671         * Copies the LocalMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
4672         * be shared to Noise classes.
4673         * @param other a LocalMap to copy
4674         */
4675        public LocalMap(LocalMap other)
4676        {
4677            super(other);
4678            terrain = other.terrain;
4679            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
4680            heat = other.heat;
4681            moisture = other.moisture;
4682            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
4683            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
4684            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
4685            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
4686            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
4687            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
4688            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
4689            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
4690            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
4691            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
4692        }
4693
4694        @Override
4695        public int wrapX(final int x, final int y)  {
4696            return Math.max(0, Math.min(x, width - 1));
4697        }
4698
4699        @Override
4700        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
4701            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4702        }
4703        
4704        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4705                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4706        {
4707            boolean fresh = false;
4708            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
4709            {
4710                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4711                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4712                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4713                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4714                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4715                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4716                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4717                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4718                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4719                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4720                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4721                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4722                cacheA = stateA;
4723                cacheB = stateB;
4724                fresh = true;
4725            }
4726            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
4727            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
4728            int t;
4729
4730            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
4731            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
4732
4733            double p,
4734                    ps, pc,
4735                    qs, qc,
4736                    h, temp,
4737                    i_w = 1.0 / width, i_h = 1.0 / (height),  ii = Math.max(i_w, i_h),
4738                    i_uw = usedWidth * i_w * ii, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h * ii, xPos, yPos = startY * i_h;
4739            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) { 
4740                xPos = startX * i_w;
4741                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
4742                    xPositions[x][y] = xPos;
4743                    yPositions[x][y] = yPos;
4744                    zPositions[x][y] = 0.0;
4745                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
4746                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
4747                            yPos, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
4748                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos
4749                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB + seedC),
4750                            seedB));
4751                    temp = 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedC + seedA);
4752                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos - temp, yPos + temp, seedC));
4753
4754                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4755                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4756                    if(fresh) {
4757                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
4758                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
4759
4760                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
4761                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
4762
4763                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
4764                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
4765                    }
4766                }
4767                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4768                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4769
4770            }
4771            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
4772                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
4773                    hMod;
4774            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
4775            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4776            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4777
4778            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
4779                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4780                    h = heightData[x][y];
4781                    heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
4782                    hMod = 1.0;
4783                    switch (t) {
4784                        case 0:
4785                        case 1:
4786                        case 2:
4787                        case 3:
4788                            h = 0.4;
4789                            hMod = 0.2;
4790                            break;
4791                        case 6:
4792                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
4793                            break;
4794                        case 7:
4795                            h *= -0.25;
4796                            break;
4797                        case 8:
4798                            h *= -0.4;
4799                            break;
4800                        default:
4801                            h *= 0.05;
4802                    }
4803                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6);
4804                    if (fresh) {
4805                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
4806                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
4807                    }
4808                }
4809            }
4810            if(fresh)
4811            {
4812                minHeat1 = ps;
4813                maxHeat1 = pc;
4814            }
4815            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
4816            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4817            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4818            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4819            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4820
4821
4822            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
4823                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4824                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
4825                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
4826                    if (fresh) {
4827                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
4828                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
4829                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
4830                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
4831                    }
4832                }
4833            }
4834            if(fresh)
4835            {
4836                minHeat = qs;
4837                maxHeat = qc;
4838                minWet = ps;
4839                maxWet = pc;
4840            }
4841            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4842        }
4843    }
4844
4845    /**
4846     * An unusual map generator that imitates an existing local map (such as a map of Australia, which it can do by
4847     * default), without applying any projection or changing heat levels in the polar regions or equator.
4848     * <a href="http://yellowstonegames.github.io/SquidLib/LocalMimicMap.png" >Example map, showing a variant on Australia</a>
4849     */
4850    public static class LocalMimicMap extends LocalMap
4851    {
4852        public GreasedRegion earth;
4853        public GreasedRegion shallow;
4854        public GreasedRegion coast;
4855        public GreasedRegion earthOriginal;
4856        /**
4857         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should look like Australia, without projecting the
4858         * land positions or changing heat by latitude. Always makes a 256x256 map.
4859         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4860         * If you were using {@link LocalMimicMap#LocalMimicMap(long, Noise2D, double)}, then this would be the
4861         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
4862         */
4863        public LocalMimicMap() {
4864            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL
4865                    , DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4866        }
4867
4868        /**
4869         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4870         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, without projecting the land positions or changing heat by latitude.
4871         * The initial seed is set to the same large long every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when
4872         * you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
4873         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4874         *
4875         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4876         */
4877        public LocalMimicMap(GreasedRegion toMimic) {
4878            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, toMimic,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
4879        }
4880
4881        /**
4882         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4883         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, without projecting the land positions or changing heat by latitude.
4884         * Takes an initial seed and the GreasedRegion containing land positions. The {@code initialSeed}
4885         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4886         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
4887         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4888         *
4889         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4890         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4891         */
4892        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic) {
4893            this(initialSeed, toMimic, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4894        }
4895
4896        /**
4897         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4898         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, without projecting the land positions or changing heat by latitude.
4899         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and a multiplier that affects the level
4900         * of detail by increasing or decreasing the number of octaves of noise used. The {@code initialSeed}
4901         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4902         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
4903         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
4904         *
4905         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4906         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4907         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4908         */
4909        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, double octaveMultiplier) {
4910            this(initialSeed, toMimic, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);
4911        }
4912
4913        /**
4914         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4915         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, without projecting the land positions or changing heat by latitude.
4916         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and parameters for noise generation (a
4917         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}. The {@code initialSeed}
4918         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call
4919         * {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact. Both FastNoise
4920         * and FastNoise make sense to use for {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter
4921         * because this will change the seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static
4922         * {@link FastNoise#instance} or {@link FastNoise#instance} because they have no changing state between runs
4923         * of the program). Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4924         *
4925         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4926         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4927         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
4928         */
4929        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise2D noiseGenerator) {
4930            this(initialSeed, toMimic, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
4931        }
4932
4933        /**
4934         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4935         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
4936         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, parameters for noise generation (a
4937         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a multiplier on how many
4938         * octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers producing even more
4939         * detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4940         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4941         * cannot be changed after the fact.  FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4942         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4943         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4944         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4945         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4946         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4947         * that don't require zooming.
4948         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4949         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4950         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
4951         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4952         */
4953        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise2D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4954            super(initialSeed, toMimic.width, toMimic.height, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
4955            earth = toMimic;
4956            earthOriginal = earth.copy();
4957            coast   = earth.copy().not().fringe(2);
4958            shallow = earth.copy().fringe(2);
4959        }
4960        /**
4961         * Stores a 256x256 GreasedRegion that shows an unprojected map of Australia, in a format that can be read back
4962         * with {@link GreasedRegion#decompress(String)}. By using GreasedRegion's compression, this takes up a lot less
4963         * room than it would with most text-based formats, and even beats uncompressed binary storage of the map by a
4964         * factor of 9.4. The map data won't change here, so this should stay compatible.
4965         */
4966        public static final String AUSTRALIA_ENCODED = "Ƥ䒅⒐᮰囨䈢ħ䐤࠰ࠨ•Ⱙအ䎢ŘňÆ䴣ȢؤF䭠゠ᔤ∠偰ഀ\u0560₠ኼܨā᭮笁\u242AЦᇅ扰रࠦ吠䠪ࠦ䠧娮⠬䠬❁Ềក\u1CAA͠敠ἒ慽Ê䄄洡儠䋻䨡㈠䙬坈མŨྈ䞻䛊哚晪⁞倰h·䡂Ļæ抂㴢္\u082E搧䈠ᇩᒠ᩠ɀ༨ʨڤʃ奲ࢠ፠ᆙả䝆䮳りĩ(ॠી᧰྄e॑ᤙ䒠剠⁌ဥࠩФΝ䂂⢴ᑠ㺀ᢣ䗨dBqÚ扜冢\u0FE5\u0A62䐠劣ေ¯䂍䞀ၰ\u0E67ᐓ〈ᄠ塠Ѡ̀ာ⠤ᡤŒęጓ憒‱〿䌳℔ᐼ䊢⁚䤿ӣ◚㙀\u0C74Ӹ抠⣀ĨǊǸ䁃း₺Ý䂁ᜤ䢑V⁄樫焠\u0A60\u2E78⎲Ĉ䁎勯戡璠悈ᠥ嘡⩩‰ನ檨㡕䶪၁@恑ࠣ䘣ࢠᅀᡎ劰桠Өॢಸ熛փࢸ䀹ఽ䅠勖ਰ۴̄ጺಢ䈠ᙠᨭ\u2FE0焠Ӡܼ䇂䒠ᯀԨĠ愜᪅䦥㶐ୀ\u09C5Ƣ*䂕ॹ∠咠р\u0604У無~⁆Г椠痠\u1CA9Ⱓס㩖ᝋ司楠२ญⳘ䬣汤ǿã㱩ᖷ掠Àݒ㑁c‾䮴,\u2452僢ᰣ缠ɋ乨\u0378䁡绑ס傓䁔瀾ሺÑ䀤ो刡开烀\u0A76Ё䈠䈰״Áj⁑䠡戢碠㘀አ䃉㪙嘈ʂø⸪௰₈㐲暤ƩDᬿ䂖剙書\u0FE0㴢\u0089㘩Ĉ䰵掀栰杁4〡Ƞ⭀\u1AE0㠰㹨Zコത\u009E䂖ࠠⴠ縣吠ᆠʡ㡀䀧否䣝Ӧ愠Ⓚ\u1CA2ಠո*①ӈԥ獀խ@㟬箬㐱\u31BE簽Ɛᩆᇞ稯禚⟶⣑аβǚ㥎Ḇ⌢㑆 搡⁗ဣ刣\u0C45䑒8怺₵⤦a5ਵ㏰ᩄ猢ฦ䬞㐷䈠呠カ愠ۀ\u1C92傠ᅼ߃ᙊ䢨ၠླྀš亀ƴ̰刷ʼ墨愠  ";
4967
4968        /**
4969         * Constructs a 256x256 unprojected local map that will use land forms with a similar shape to Australia.
4970         * @param initialSeed
4971         * @param noiseGenerator
4972         * @param octaveMultiplier
4973         */
4974        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, Noise2D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier)
4975        {
4976            this(initialSeed,
4977                    GreasedRegion.decompress(AUSTRALIA_ENCODED), noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
4978        }
4979
4980        /**
4981         * Copies the LocalMimicMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
4982         * be shared to Noise classes.
4983         * @param other a LocalMimicMap to copy
4984         */
4985        public LocalMimicMap(LocalMimicMap other)
4986        {
4987            super(other);
4988            earth = other.earth.copy();
4989            earthOriginal = other.earthOriginal.copy();
4990            coast   = other.coast.copy();
4991            shallow = other.shallow.copy();
4992        }
4993
4994
4995
4996        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4997                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4998        {
4999            boolean fresh = false;
5000            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
5001            {
5002                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5003                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5004                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5005                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5006                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5007                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5008                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5009                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5010                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5011                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5012                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5013                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5014                cacheA = stateA;
5015                cacheB = stateB;
5016                fresh = true;
5017            }
5018            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
5019            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
5020            int t;
5021
5022            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
5023            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
5024
5025            earth.remake(earthOriginal);
5026
5027            if(zoom > 0)
5028            {
5029                int stx = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartX - (width  >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), width ),
5030                        sty = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartY - (height >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), height);
5031                for (int z = 0; z < zoom; z++) {
5032                    earth.zoom(stx, sty).expand8way().fray(0.5).expand();
5033                }
5034                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
5035                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
5036            }
5037            else
5038            {
5039                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2);
5040                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2);
5041            }
5042            double p,
5043                    ps, pc,
5044                    qs, qc,
5045                    h, temp,
5046                    i_w = 1.0 / width, i_h = 1.0 / (height),
5047                    i_uw = usedWidth * i_w * i_w, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h * i_h, xPos, yPos = startY * i_h;
5048            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
5049                xPos = startX * i_w;
5050                for (int x = 0, xt = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
5051                    xPositions[x][y] = (xPos - .5) * 2.0;
5052                    yPositions[x][y] = (yPos - .5) * 2.0;
5053                    zPositions[x][y] = 0.0;
5054
5055                    if(earth.contains(x, y))
5056                    {
5057                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
5058                                        terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
5059                                yPos, seedA)) * 0.85;
5060                        if(coast.contains(x, y))
5061                            h += 0.05;
5062                        else
5063                            h += 0.15;
5064                    }
5065                    else
5066                    {
5067                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
5068                                        terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
5069                                yPos, seedA)) * -0.9;
5070                        if(shallow.contains(x, y))
5071                            h = (h - 0.08) * 0.375;
5072                        else
5073                            h = (h - 0.125) * 0.75;
5074                    }
5075                    //h += landModifier - 1.0;
5076                    heightData[x][y] = h;
5077                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos
5078                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB + seedC),
5079                            seedB));
5080                    temp = 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedC + seedA);
5081                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos - temp, yPos + temp, seedC));
5082
5083                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
5084                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
5085                    if(fresh) {
5086                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
5087                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
5088
5089                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
5090                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
5091
5092                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
5093                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
5094                    }
5095                }
5096                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
5097                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
5098
5099            }
5100            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
5101                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
5102                    hMod;
5103            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
5104            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5105            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5106
5107            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
5108                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
5109                    h = heightData[x][y];
5110                    heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
5111                    hMod = 1.0;
5112                    switch (t) {
5113                        case 0:
5114                        case 1:
5115                        case 2:
5116                        case 3:
5117                            h = 0.4;
5118                            hMod = 0.2;
5119                            break;
5120                        case 6:
5121                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
5122                            break;
5123                        case 7:
5124                            h *= -0.25;
5125                            break;
5126                        case 8:
5127                            h *= -0.4;
5128                            break;
5129                        default:
5130                            h *= 0.05;
5131                    }
5132                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6);
5133                    if (fresh) {
5134                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
5135                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
5136                    }
5137                }
5138            }
5139            if(fresh)
5140            {
5141                minHeat1 = ps;
5142                maxHeat1 = pc;
5143            }
5144            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
5145            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5146            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5147            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5148            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5149
5150
5151            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
5152                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
5153                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
5154                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
5155                    if (fresh) {
5156                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
5157                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
5158                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
5159                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
5160                    }
5161                }
5162            }
5163            if(fresh)
5164            {
5165                minHeat = qs;
5166                maxHeat = qc;
5167                minWet = ps;
5168                maxWet = pc;
5169            }
5170            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
5171        }
5172    }
5173}
